pageContext.claim: “I knocked out the CSRs; that was a subsidy to the insurance companies. That was a gift that was, frankly, what they gave the insurance companies. Just take a look at their stocks....And they have given them, you could almost call it, a payoff. And it's a disgrace. And that money goes to the insurance companies.”
pageContext.analysis: Insurance companies don’t make money through cost-sharing reductions — they are being paid back for money they’ve already spent on behalf of people who purchased their health plans. The CSRs do not prop up the stock price of the companies.
